description: While this is definitely a seafood-focused place, I had the best ever lamb burger here: the light toasted bread, the touch of bacon and blue cheese--it was simply perfect. I will be sure to come back to try other things. Very good service too.
author: ana m.

description: I ended up at Anchor & Hope as a last minute idea from my friend.  We were told the wait would be about 20 minutes, but we could sit at the communal table right away.  We figured why not!  The people we encountered were very nice and the wait staff is very good.  We had separate servers for the drinks and food, which was a little confusing at first but that seems to be a trend lately at restaurants around the city.  Regardless, both servers were nice and friendly - and quick.  We were in a rush to make a movie and they made us a priority.  Very cool for a first time at a restaurant.  We shared oysters that were fabulous, and then we tried the blackened prawns appetizer which was good (but not very filling).  We finished it off with a lobster roll, which was the best part of the meal.  Great bread/lobster mix - definitely try it if you go.  I'll be back here for sure...oh yeah - great decor too!
author: Roman A.

description: great happy hour, excellent oysters! i give 4 stars b/c the beer wasn't very cold, and our bartender wasn't very friendly and didn't smile once during our visit. cool decor and great happy hour from 430pm-6pm.
author: Julie M.

description: Excellent from start to finish.  Grabbed a seat at the bar.  Good vibe to the place.  Nicely decorated - nautical bent.  Extremely friendly staff.  Fresh baguettes and salty butter.  We shared the ceviche, lobster roll and roasted cauliflower.  All were prepared well and so flavorful.  The lobster roll is incredibly rich - sharing worked well for us.  Will definitely be back!
author: L F.

description: Good food but, alas, at a price.  I love the space and decor.  The sea urchin/potato appetizer was worthy of the rave reviews.  The clams also did not disappoint.  I ordered some oysters on the half shell heeding the advice of the staff on which ones to try; they were all right but nothing truly great.  Best was the ease of getting a table!
author: S B.

description: The food here is very well done - my minor gripe is that the service was surprisingly reactive.  We arrived before our dinner companions, and although the "front desk" knew they were caught late in traffic, no one offered us something to drink during our wait.  We took the initiative and did get our drinks.  Same thing with ordering our meals - after a very long wait, we got someone's attention and then our orders were taken.  Same thing for dessert.  This is certainly not a big issue, so don't be afraid to speak up if you feel ignored.  This restaurant deserves to be busy because it's food is very good.
author: Bonnie L.

description: I just tried this restaurant for a friend's birthday last night. It was wonderful. We met early for the happy hour specials...$5 wine, $1 oysters. The white wine they offered for happy hour was delicious (not the typical cheapo wine) and the oysters were tasty! I really like the decor of the restaurant...exposed brick, wood beams, nautical but not cheesy feel. We had a very friendly waiter who when asked what his favorite dish is on the menu said they are all wonderful...except to go with the lobster roll for lunch not dinner. And he was right. Half of our table ordered fish dishes, the other half meat dishes. My fish and chips were crispy and flavourful. The rosemary salted potato wedges were definitely a step up from the regular fries. My friends ordered the spiced lobster tail, pork chop, and steak...of which I tried a bite from each....and I have to give those dishes rave reviews as well. But we topped it off with a chocolate cake topped with salted walnuts...the salty/sweet combo was to die for! All that said...I will definitely return to Anchor and Hope!
author: Kelly M.

description: really good shit! thoroughly enjoyed both times i went. totally recommend it
author: Shan C.

description: OK, I am torn on Anchor & Hope - our meal had so much momentum going into the main course.  While waiting for our table at the bar, the bartender was excellent chatting about the extensive beer list and sharing his favorite menu items.  Our server was fantastic - she quickly assessed that I was with a group who had not seen one other in a long time so there would be lots of chatting and a few glasses of wine before ordering.  And I loved the space.  Appetizers were good - bacon wrapped oysters (Angels on Horseback), fried calamari with chili sauce, and fries that were more like chips - very addictive.  I was prepared to love this restaurant.  My entree came - lobster roll with chips and coleslaw and although it looked lovely, the lobster was over-salted and when added to the salt on the chips, made eating the coleslaw as a palate cleanser mandatory.  Maybe I just mis-ordered (but a $24 sandwich should be good, right?)?  The halibut looked delicious as did the hanger steak.  Based on the food, I would give it 2-stars, but perhaps with more judicious ordering it really is a 4-star like the other reviewers state.  We'll see...
author: Lori G.

description: this is a great place to take out of towners who want fresh seafood. the location is inconspicuous, on minna and second, and despite what some of the reviews say, i think the atmosphere compliments the food perfectly. prices are fair as far as seafood goes. we ordered the fries with eyes (never seen anything like it before...although they didn't have a lot of flavor it was a fun appetizer) and we each had an entree. there were so many choices we all had a hard time deciding what to get but ended up with a lobster roll, scallops with pork belly and mashed potatoes, sea bass and fish and chips. they also have a pretty extensive wine list. only drawback was that we made a reservation on open table for 8pm, but didn't actually get seated until after 8:30, but we were able to grab drinks from the bar and hang out until our table was ready. i'm adding this one to the arsenal of choices for the future!
author: Kate M.

description: i agree with others who say the food is only okay, and too e$$pensive
author: Erica C.

description: a perfect place for a sunny lunch!   it's open and airy with a brushed metal, silvery mirror, wooden plank feel to it.  a place where chilled white wine or a cold crisp beer is a given.  i had a delicious crab louie salad with the freshest, juicy crab, and my friends had lamb burgers which were also super flavorful and moist.  the ribbon fries were interesting -- like little potato chips in strips -- and fun to eat.  the prawn appetizer was probably my favorite, so succulent and full of flavor, but i was sad there were only 3.  and i love epi bread!   i will be back for sure.
author: M J.
